alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 7:13PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ouachita Parish through 745 PM CDT... At 712 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm between Monroe and Swartz. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Swartz, Millhaven and Fairbanks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
